alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:57PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk River Valleys... The Kobuk and Noatak Valleys had 1-3 inches of rain earlier this week, with another 1-3 inches expected there through Friday. This will cause sharp rises on all rivers in the Noatak and Kobuk Basins through this weekend. At this time large rivers such as the Kobuk and Noatak are not expected to flood, but smaller rivers and creeks could reach bankfull. The high water will cause many logs to float down rivers in this area. People traveling and recreating on rivers and streams draining the Noatak and Kobuk Valleys are encouraged to monitor water levels since some exposed gravel bars could become inundated due to runoff from the rainfall. For the latest weather forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks, and for the latest river forecasts go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.

area.areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys
